smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams found. All 19 pages contain diagram elements. Each diagram has at least one element (classes, tables, use cases, states, or actions).

All use case ovals in the use case diagrams (pages 2-3) are associated with at least one actor. Page 2: 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' are all connected to actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur, Süsteem). Page 3: All 7 use cases are connected to Autode haldur and/or Juhataja.
No duplicate use case names describing the same activity with the same actor were found. Page 2 has 4 distinct use cases and page 3 has 7 distinct use cases, all with unique activity descriptions.
In the package diagram (page 1), all elements within each package have unique names. No duplicate element names were found within the same package.

While similar column names like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple classifier tables, these represent different contextual data (each classifier type has its own name/status). No actual redundant data storage without FK relationships was identified.

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern (Estonian imperative verbs): Page 2: Tuvasta, Vaata, Vaata, Vaata. Page 3: Registreeri, Lõpeta, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Muuda, Vaata, Unusta. All 11 use cases start with active verbs.

State diagram (page 9) has 6 states: Algus (initial), Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud. All states are reachable: Ootel from Algus; Aktiivne/Unustatud from Ootel; Mitteaktiivne from Aktiivne; Lõpetatud from Aktiivne or Mitteaktiivne.

Activity diagram (page 4) has all actions reachable from the start node (Algus). Actions 'Vaata kõiki autosid mida saab lõpetada', 'Otsi autot', 'Vali auto', 'Lõpeta valitud auto' are all connected through the flow with decision nodes.

All relationships in class diagrams (pages 5-13) and database diagrams (pages 14-19) have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: '1 0..*', '0..1 0..*', '0..* 1' are consistently shown on relationship lines.

Counted central elements per diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases; Page 3: 7 use cases; Page 5: 3 classes; Page 6: 6 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 6 states; Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 13: 3 classes; Page 14: 4 tables; Page 15: 9 tables; Page 16: 3 tables; Page 17: 6 tables; Page 18: 2 tables; Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 (page 15). Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connections per element on each diagram page. Maximum connections found: Page 6 (Isik): 5 lines; Page 10 (Töötaja): 5 lines; Page 12 (Auto): 4 lines; Page 17 (Auto): 4 lines; Page 19 (Tootaja): 4 lines. Maximum is 5 lines from Isik/Töötaja. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.
Based on the diagram layouts, related elements appear to be positioned at reasonable distances. No relationship distance appears to exceed twice the average distance between elements on any diagram.

All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (Estonian imperative forms): Use cases: Tuvasta, Vaata, Registreeri, Lõpeta, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Unusta. Activity actions: Vaata, Otsi, Vali, Lõpeta. All 11 use cases and 4 actions start with active verbs.

All class, table, attribute, and use case names have 4 or more characters. Shortest names found: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Auto' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars), 'kood' (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 chars. Since all names have ≥4 chars, smell is NOT present.

All class names start with uppercase letters and are singular: Isik, Auto, Töötaja, Klient, Kasutajakonto, Klassifikaator, Riik, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kütuse_liik, Auto_kategooria_tüüp, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Töötaja_seisundi_liik, Töötaja_roll, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Töötaja_rolli_omamine, Auto_kategooria_omamine.

All attribute and column names start with lowercase letters: isik_id, isikukood, e_meil, nimetus, on_aktiivne, kood, reg_aeg, synni_kp, eesnimi, perenimi, elukoht, parool, mudel, vin_kood, auto_kood, etc. No uppercase-starting attributes found.

All database table names are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Tootaja, Klient, Auto, Riik, Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_roll, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_rolli_omamine, Auto_kategooria_omamine.

No type prefixes (tbl_, uc_, str, int, etc.) found on class, table, or attribute names. The prefixes PK_, FK_, pfK, and IXFK_ are present but are explicitly allowed by the rule for indicating primary keys, foreign keys, partial foreign keys, and indexes.
